website_summaries.verdict: Boasting a padded mesh construction, a top handle, and both chest and back leash connectors, this option achieves a fantastic blend of comfort and security. A solid choice for budget-minded pet parents.
pros: Dual D rings allow owners to alternate between the back or front leash connection
Easy-grip top handle for added control in excitable situations
Padded mesh is comfortable and breathable to combat chafing and overheating
Reflective lining provides extra safety in low light conditions
Affordable without skimping on features or quality
cons: Adjusting it to the proper fit can be a bit of a chore

website_summaries.verdict: A simple to put on, take off harness with adjustable slide straps for a customized fit for all dogs.
pros: Strong, with 3M heavy reflective Oxford material
Good for walking or running at night
Handle for more control, and comfy padding
cons: Straps could be stronger and it may take some trial and error for dog and owner to adjust

customer_reviews.title: finally a harness my dogs didnt break
customer_reviews.text: So this is my 3rd harness. I bought one and tried it with the stronger of the 2 dogs, he did not break it. These are really easy to put on, the dogs seem to be comfortable, and they dont break!! LOVE THEM!!
customer_reviews.author: Stormy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended by this dog trainer!
customer_reviews.text: I own my own dog training business and recommend this harness to every one of my clients when training loose leash walking. This harness is SO durable (even for teething puppies!) The front clip is excellent for the early stages of training, helps the dog learn that pulling is unacceptable. I also love how it has the top clip on the back as well, it's great for dogs transitioning out of the puppy age. It's relfective as well which is great for those early morning walks/late night walks. The straps are customizable so it also ensures a great fit for each dog. I really cannot recommend this harness enough!
customer_reviews.author: Caity

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommend this harness !!
customer_reviews.text: This harness has changed the way my dog walks! He is a strong pit mix who pulled constantly. Not sure exactly how it works, but our walks are much more enjoyable when he's not pulling my arm out of the socket! We bought the large for our 60 lb pup and there's definitely room to grow.
customer_reviews.author: A Marcin

customer_reviews.title: Pink & Blue harness. Totally recommend for any fur babies!
customer_reviews.text: Since nobody posted their pets in the pink and blue harness I’ll show off my children!! Both are very cute colors on my dogs, I have walked both of them and my babygirl in the pink loves to pull when she sees another dog and this certainly did the job on the pull handle. I recommend getting this harness.
customer_reviews.author: Hana M.

customer_reviews.title: Dog Loves it !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product my dog neno loves his new harness he's wearing it like a champ.if you don't know I have a pitbull terrier he's only 1 years old and very active this harness was a life savor. And I order mind in Large keep in mind my pit is a puppy.
customer_reviews.author: jaiquan frazier

customer_reviews.title: Best harness I have found
customer_reviews.text: Best harness I have found for my dachshund. I tried many others and searched a long time before finding this harness. I had problems with the harness rubbing sores on my dogs legs. I purchased this harness because it had a measurement for the strap that is under the dogs belly. It was the only one I found to list this measurement.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 92lb lab mix that really likes to pull. The front clip option really helps curb that. I also put it on her when we are having company because it has the handle on the back (the oh crap handle) that is easy to grasp if she wants to jump on someone. It seems comfortable and it doesn't shift to the side like others I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Big Fan

customer_reviews.title: Works good so far!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clip on and off my dogs! I hate the ones they have to step into I have an 11 year old Akita has joint issues so I love that she can be sitting and I can put this on her. Love the front clips which keeps my 2 year old boxer in check when I need her attention. But the clips and handle do worry me. So far no issues but I worry they won’t hold up long term or for a dog that pulls or jerks really hard.
customer_reviews.author: Sharissa Andreas

customer_reviews.title: Very well made. Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: I have a French Bulldog that has severe disc problems in her neck and she cannot wear a collar. This seems the take any pressure off her neck and back. I also like the fact it has the ring on top and a ring at the chest to hook your leash up to. Update: the first one was such a success that I ordered two more for my other frenchies! Easy to put on and take off.
customer_reviews.author: Whatever It’s my opinion

customer_reviews.title: Great harness.
customer_reviews.text: This harness seems perfect for our dog. She slipped out of her old one so we ordered this one.
customer_reviews.author: Paula K. Schiely

customer_reviews.title: After One Week One Strap Broke.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly one week after I purchased this, one of the straps broke. I bought size large for a 65 lb, 1 year old Golden Retriever/Lab mix. I liked the product for the first six days I had it. I am wondering whether the one I received was just defective? Will the seller replace mine?
customer_reviews.author: CabinBoy121

customer_reviews.title: Dog broke out, don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: The 2nd time I used this harness my dog broke out of it. Not only did the plastic clip break, it completely ripped at one of the seams. My dog was running around free, luckily we were able to catch him, but that might not have been the case. I don't recommend this product at all!
customer_reviews.author: Krystl

customer_reviews.title: Caused a Large Gash on Dog’s Neck
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this harness less than two months ago. The inside of the neck opening ripped. It was held together by glue. The rubbing of the sharp glue and ripped material resulted in a large gash on my dog’s neck. I thought my 25 pound boston terrier, Mitch, did not want to go on walks anymore. I assumed he was feeling lazy or would rather play fetch at home. However, I noticed a huge gash on his neck. Surely enough, I checked his harness and realized the broken, cheap material was rubbing and cutting his neck during our walks. No wonder he did not want to put this harness on. Please beware and do not buy this harness.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch’s Mom

customer_reviews.title: It appears to be terribly sewn. I'm unsure if we received a defective ...
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this product on April 9th for our 40lb black lab puppy. Only one month of use and the strap has already ripped clean off. It appears to be terribly sewn. I'm unsure if we received a defective product or if this is standard for this brand as it was our first purchase of this particular company. Extremely disappointed! I'm in process of contacting the company and will provide a followup to my review as soon as I hear from them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great harness for our Bernese Mountain Dog!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome dog harness! We have a Bernese Mountain Dog puppy (currently around 80 lbs) and the large harness is almost as small as it goes. As he gets to full size there should still be plenty of room to make the harness bigger. I like the handle on the top which makes catching him easier. Putting it on and off is simply with just two buckles. We don't have much issue with it pinching his hair. There are two metal attachment points for a leash. One on the back near the handle and another one on the chest. The chest point makes it more awkward for him to pull on the leash when we walk which is really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Great for mini pigs
customer_reviews.text: Using it for my 115 lb mini pig. It works great. The handle on the back allows me to pick him up into the car.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product with great options
customer_reviews.text: I have a very large pit/ Mastiff. The harness fits well. Comfortable, no pinching in the arm pits. I believe in walking a dog attached from the front chest tithe collar. It allows for no pulling. Harness that say no pull and only connect from the back actually encourage the pulling instinct, especially in working dog breads. I'll let you know how long the fittings last. I am questioning there durability.
customer_reviews.author: Moreorless

customer_reviews.title: Started to rip
customer_reviews.text: At first we loved this harness but after 2 months it started to rip apart from my lab. Unfortunately we had to go with something else. Maybe it was just a bad batch we got wish I could have used it longer if it lasted I would of gave much higher reviews
customer_reviews.author: Logeybogey1010

customer_reviews.title: Would have been a good harness! Stops pulling but leaves a rash
customer_reviews.text: Have a 55 pound pitbull. Bought her a medium and fit snug have her a rash. So,I bought the next size up a large and she got yet anither rash. Whenever she pulls the back part of tge leash rubs against her arm puts. Really sucks because this leash really stopped her from pulling ! She walked so amazingly!!!!!! But had to return
customer_reviews.author: NCleidomastoid

customer_reviews.title: Design causes blistering on back of dogs legs.
customer_reviews.text: At first the harness seemed perfect; fit, comfort effectiveness while walking. Our dog walked slower, with us, and didn't fight us. Then lastnight we noticed that the spots where the plastic buckles sit under her legs rubbed off all her hair and blistered her skin badly. I won't put this on her ever Again. We were going to buy one for our larger dog but not now.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Kern

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product if you love your dog
customer_reviews.text: I am VERY disappointed in this product. It is not made for large dogs. Maybe if you had something less than 30lbs it would be good. I have a chocolate lab bought the size they recommended according to the size chart and it does not fit. My dog was rubbed RAW from this harness!!! Do not BUY THIS! It doesn't matter it the straps are loose or tight it does not fit.
customer_reviews.author: amazon91

customer_reviews.title: I like this one because it fits like a full harness
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other no-pull harness' but they've never worked. I like this one because it fits like a full harness, not like the ones that just go across the chest. My dog pulled so much that the across the chest harness would just twist around. This one fits him very well, and it's padded with I like. We just took this for a test run last night and it works great. As soon as he would pull he got turned around, no pulling at all by the end of the walk. I recommend this harness. High marks for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Sedwick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for walks
customer_reviews.text: This harness has been fantastic in walking my pit bull and dutch shepherd. The material used for these harnesses feels much more comfortable than harnesses ive used in the past and my pups don't mind wearing them for extended periods of time when we are out on walks or at the local dog park.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy, well built harness. Great product for the price. It’s adjustable and I can tell my 80 lb puppy will still have plenty of room to grow into the xtra large size. It is reflective, made of nice soft material and has a handle on the back. I would recommend and buy again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: J. Grotegut

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I have a Red Heeler mixed and he is as strong as a bull! I had issues with being able to walk him without him pulling on the leash and killing my back. This harness gives me 100% control of him. He still pulls but the harness allows a better center of gravity so we're not pulling against one another. The only issue I had with it was size...my dog is 48lbs and all muscle so i originally ordered a medium which was too small. A large did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: K8GR8

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I received this and looks nice. I put it on my puppy who is 10 weeks old. With in 30 mins he found a way to get it off and it’s ripped into 2 pieces. Didn’t even have the harness for 24 hrs. It’s next but not durable.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon P

customer_reviews.title: Finally something that works
customer_reviews.text: I have tried every type of harness I could get my hands on. Gentle lead, easy walk, thunder leash, pinch collars.....nothing worked until now! I like that we can clip on the front and back. When it's clipped to the front it really helps my 1y.o. Lab not to pull! The handle on the back is great if she wants to chase bunnies so I can just hang right onto it. 4 stars because it's kind of hard to get off, we have the neck parts tight to fit her but her head is too big! I think once she starts filling out we can loosen them and it will be easier.
customer_reviews.author: SMaca

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have an Aussie Cattle dog about 65 lbs and got this in lime green size large. Nothing ever fits him and I get frustrated but I love this! We do a lot of hiking in lush areas so I got the lime green so it can be easily seen. It's got a strap top and bottom and very padded for your pooch. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ash M.

customer_reviews.title: Would love for the company to give me a new one ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 7 month old lab and had him outside on his leash attached to the front part of the harness. The attachment ripped right off. Would love for the company to give me a new one since this is defective. I do not use the harness that much either for this to have broke like this.
customer_reviews.author: deborah davis

customer_reviews.title: My Retriever easily ate thru harness in 2 minutes, NO warranty info available
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Love the fluorescent piping on the harness. Seemed well made. I liked the look of the harness. CONS: My dog chewed thru this harness and I couldn't find any warranty information on Amazon. I also couldn't find RABBITGOO's web site to see any warranty information. This product will NOT stop your dog from pulling unless you attach the leash to the under collar connection. When I tried that method, it made walking the dog very awkward. If you look at the picture, You will see the clip and the harness had been eaten(marked with blue tape). If my dog hadn't eaten thru the harness, I would have given it a much better rating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Buyer_For_21_yrs

customer_reviews.title: Seriously... Do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: Was great at first then the material started to stretch so it became looser. About 2 months into having it she pulled forward on her leash and the front hook ripped off and she got loose and ran away. (Found her the next day). It was the correct size harness and she only uses it for about 2 hours once a week. DO NOT BUY! Edit: the first photo is where the front hook ripped off. The second one is where the back harness is starting to fray and the threading coming out, we only used that hook once.
customer_reviews.author: Karen R

customer_reviews.title: Great for your Furry Friends!
customer_reviews.text: Harness is easy to put on & take off, which is really nice. You do not need to have your dog lift his/her front leg to put the harness on, like other harnesses. Harness is adjustable; however, a little harder than other harness to adjust - the straps don't move very easily ... which could be good or bad. Harness has a ring to attach the lead on both the top and underneath area depending on how you like to walk to your dog. Overall I would recommend this harness to my furry friends.
customer_reviews.author: CumminsPub

customer_reviews.title: Appears well constructed
customer_reviews.text: Initially I ordered a medium size and I did measure my dog as the vendor page guide advised. However upon arrival it was just too tight with all the expansion allowed. So I retuned it and ordered a size large. Amazon made the return easy and convenient. I have just started using it so I can’t speak yet to it’s durability, but it appears well constructed, and I loved the variety of color choices. The Rabbitgoo brand came with a great deal of favorable reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Decent but flawed.
customer_reviews.text: I like my other one better but this one is OK. It makes her walk funny though. It's easy to put on. A little larger than I expected for a medium. But it serves its purpose. I have a husky so pulling is inevitable. But it works way better than when I don't have one on her lol UPDATE: She has snapped out of this harness twice by running full force after seeing a cat. Also she has figured out how to wiggle her way out. Granted my dog is a great escape artists and dedicates her life to escaping. So I think this harness is idea for dogs with great recall and not dogs who are strong and powerful.
customer_reviews.author: lakisha

customer_reviews.title: My dog slips right out
customer_reviews.text: My dog can slip out pretty easily if she pulls backwards. For example, she’s in the yard on a long leash and she wraps herself around a bush. Then tries to pull away backing up. Slips right out.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Stigger

customer_reviews.title: Buckles broke during first use.
customer_reviews.text: Product broke the first day my dog wore it. Both buckles on the front strap broke causing the harness to continually loosen. I removed the hardness and placed her old one back on.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Silverman

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Prevent Pulling
customer_reviews.text: I was so hopeful for this harness. We have gone through 2 Easy Walker harness' and they were amazing. But...when left on or within reach of a precocious pup (which they warn against), our dog chewed through them. So, I figured this Rabbitgoo would work and he wouldn't be able to chew through it. I was right...he didn't chew through it BUT...I almost pulled my arm out walking him because it does NOT subdue him the way the Easy Walker harness does. I had no choice but to order another 3 in 1 Easy Walker Deluxe harness. I'm glad Rabbitgoo worked for others but it just didn't work for us. I found it to be a complete waste of $$.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Gutman

customer_reviews.title: DANGER! No fast unclip for part that goes over head
customer_reviews.text: I had to cut my dog out of this. The harness is very well made. Unfortunately,my dog got 1 paw out of the part around the chest and she freaked out when I tried to bring her paw back through. Since it was already snug before she did that, she was very unhappy. It was painful for me to try to loosen it. If there was a break away clasp it would have been much safer!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 2mnths can't return....
customer_reviews.text: Went with this brand due to the glowing reviews and what not but I guess I just became unlucky. Somehow the harness broke from the bottom. We were at the dog park and after she had a fun filled day when we go to get into the car i see the harness come loose and of course she just took it off. Sad because I really liked how it looked but I guess it has very little durability. Our other one, Idepet No-Pull Dog Harness, has lasted since 2017 (when we got her) and still have it but is worn out, better quality though since its held through and she's a very energetic pup.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get on and off my schnauzer-mix puppy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to get on and off my schnauzer-mix puppy. I wouldn't say he enjoys the process of it going on and off, but he is learning to tolerate the process. We leave it on him during the days and he does not try to bite at it or show any signs that it bothers him, so it must be comfortable. I like that it's reflective. The harness is adjustable, so we were able to get a pretty good fit, although our guy is a rescue and is still fairly undernourished and filling out. Even so, he can't pull out of it and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: cowink4

customer_reviews.title: Amazing harness!!!!! Saves my shoulder/arm during walks!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was really doubting a harness could stop my super mutt from pulling my arm off on walks but this one is awesome!!! I was so surprised at how well it worked! He would go to lunge ahead and the harness stopped him! My dog would look over at me “ like what is happening?” My pup was walking next to me and it was so nice!! I even got my phone out and didn’t worry that he was going to knock it out of my hands!!!! I recommend this harness to anyone who has a dog that is a rabid puller!!! It works and I’m soooo happy!!! Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Horrible harness!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so upset about this purchase! I bought it based on the good reviews but that wasn’t my experience. I put it on my husky and adjusted the straps to take him for a walk. Within 15 minutes he had gotten out of it and took off running down the road. Fortunately we live at the end of our subdivision but we could have easily been somewhere that he could have ran off and gotten lost or killed! I blamed it on myself at first thinking I hadn’t fixed the straps right but later my husband came home and put it on him and the same thing happened again! Horrible harness!
customer_reviews.author: M&m

customer_reviews.title: Husky approved harness
customer_reviews.text: Walking my 3 huskies is no joke. They get so crazy excited for their walks and do a lot of pulling. I wanted something more secure so I could prevent them from escaping by their collars (it’s happened once). So far I really like this harness on them, I do feel better in control and notice less pulling already. I personally use only the back hook option since it feels more secure. If you’re on the fence of buying I’d say give it a shot. For reference my dogs fit into the large size.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette :)

customer_reviews.title: Corgi approved!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Sturdy material with non-pull features. Leash is able to connect on top as well as down below to help with training. Also, there is a sturdy handle to hold them still. Fits perfectly and can be adjusted in many ways to fit all body types (including a corgi’s long torso). I bought a size small and it fit my 15 pound, 8 month old corgi perfectly! Highly recommend this for all dog owners!
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher

customer_reviews.title: Its the best harness. Its so good that I ordered two ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a great harness and very easy to adjust and use. One thing I noticed on the last two harnesses I ordered : The bottom straps that go around the belly and sides are inside out. Meaning the reflective stiches are on the inside not being visible.
customer_reviews.author: J. C.

customer_reviews.title: looked comfy but ended up injuring my dog and had to free her in emergency
customer_reviews.text: maybe this was a fluke but my dog somehow was injured by this. we put in on, tied her to tie out and when she was walking her leash got stepped on and it somehow shifted over her arm and pulled hwe paw straight up and she couldn't walk, it became super tight and restrictive her immensely. we had to get a scissors to cut it off her in an emergency effort to free her. she's about 65 pounds, golden. luckily we were right there to help her. but i thought she Initially pulled her paw out of socket or something.
customer_reviews.author: 1Love1

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: When I say my dog is strong, it's an understatement. She's all muscle and she likes to pull a lot on walks. This was perfect! I can't believe how much easier it is to control her now. The chest clip is the one we prefer to use, it allows full control of our dog. The handle on the back is a nice and sturdy. Also she seems more chill in the harness just wearing it around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Heather hanshaw

customer_reviews.title: Harness works as advertized
customer_reviews.text: Needed a harness a dog couldn't back out of because we adopted a puppy mill breeder rescue that at 10 yrs old has never been out if a pen. It's working and she's coming along fine. She eats up love and attention, something she never got as just a puppy machine. Don't give puppy mills business!! Adopt don't shop! There are thousands of dogs needing homes. Do the right thing and adopt a rescue dog instead of buying a puppy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Saint Pete Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Less than six months use and clasp is broken
customer_reviews.text: I I am editing my review I initially posted a five star review because I was really happy with how the harness looked and felt. I’m very disappointed that a $20 harness for a 19 lbs. dog is no longer usable after 6 months. The clasp is made of plastic and broke. To be fair the harness I bought my other dog is still working fine so perhaps it was just a defect but it feels unfair that I only got six months use for the price. I really wanted to like this but I’m reluctant to order another small size harness after the first one breaking on me.
customer_reviews.author: Working for a living

customer_reviews.title: I was so excited.....
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews, so many good reviews, so I measured my pup and looked carefully to make sure I bought the right size. Small was to little so I went with Medium, which was still completely in the right range. I was SOOOO EXCITED to try this! Joy is a high stress rescue pup, we have been working with her on pulling with little change. I bought this because of the reviews. I got it on her with ease and tighten it up around her. She slipped out of it, AGAIN so many said they would not, before slipping out it did nothing to stop her from pulling. All around a total waste I am so disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: CRS

customer_reviews.title: They should be more clear about the sizes for each breed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a large for my lab-mix believing large would be simply for large dog breeds and XL being for giant breeds like mastiffs or st bernards. If they could add something like weight next to each size, that would be a lot easier to understand. Fortunately, my neighbor next door has a pit bull and I was able to give it to her to try for her dog who is a notorious puller. Works like an absolute charm. She can't stop talking about how much it has helped for their walks which is great to hear. I'll be ordering the XL one for my own dog now. At least the L won't go to waste.
customer_reviews.author: Milagros Maisonet

customer_reviews.title: Great harness for dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I’m very happy with this purchase. Bought it for my German Shepherd because his old harness was too worn out. It looks great. The only thing is make sure you measure your dog before buying it and disregard the picture of the adult Shepherd dog advertising the large size. The correct size for an adult German Shepherd dog is X-Large.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Still pulling but good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Silly me, I was so desperate for some type of walking harness that would minimize my very strong dog's pulling that I believed the product description indicating it was a no-pull harness. My Husky/Pitbull mix still pulls like a steam train in the Rabbitgoo harness. I was using a Gentle Leader head collar before the harness and it did help a little but kept slipping up right under her eye(s). I though a harness would be a more comfortable solution but alas, the pulling is worse now. The Rabbitgoo harness is very sturdy and well-made, and it does seem comfortable on my dog, however, I will be giving the head collar another shot.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip L.

customer_reviews.title: Not an XL
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be an XL, but it doesn't come close to fitting my great dane. And now when returning it, they say I'm a few days too late and won't allow a return. While many merchants have extended return windows due to corona virus, this vendor did not. So now I'm stuck with a harness that would fit a much smaller dog, and I can't use it. Not a true XL size at all.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Scott

customer_reviews.title: size advertised is much smaller than actual size!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Labrador Retriever with a 33" chest and 24" neck; going by the sizing chart advertised, the large size should have fit just fine. The size large notes the range going up to 36 inches for the chest. With the belts pulled out to the very limit, it just barely reached around his chest, creating a very tight and uncomfortable "fit". I wish the advertising would match the actual item, as I never would have wasted my time buying this. The short top strap looked ridiculously flimsy, by the way, and would never allow an adult man's hand through the tiny opening. I was able to return for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: E. Iverson

customer_reviews.title: This style of harness is restrictive and can cause injuries
customer_reviews.text: Do a little research before purchasing this harness. I had no idea but this type of harness restricts shoulder movement, encourages compensation in gait, and can cause injuries. I really loved this harness because it does prevent a lot of pulling, and the handle on the back has come in handy with some scuffles at the dog park. It's sturdy and reflective. Our 3 yr old lab mix rescue did develop a shoulder injury after using this harness for a few months. Hopefully no long term damage. The Y or H harnesses are supposed to be safest.
customer_reviews.author: deimos319

customer_reviews.title: Fits my corgi well!
customer_reviews.text: I bought size Small for my 8 month old 22 lb Welsh Corgi puppy and it fits him perfectly with room to spare. I was a little hesitant to buy online especially since he is still growing, but this fits him so well now and it looks like it should fit him when he's fully grown too. It's a great harness! It's adjustable, the color is great (orange), I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: KNova

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my pulling dog, and is very well made
customer_reviews.text: This has worked great with our dog (a mix about the size of a lab). The materials seem very durable and it was put together well. The straps are a little difficult to adjust, so be ready to spend some time on that. However I think I would rather they be tough to adjust, and stay where I set them versus having them easy to adjust, but always having to re-adjust them. I would definitely recommend this for anyone who has a dog that pulls. Save your shoulders and your stress! I reduces the amount my dog pulls by at least 75%
customer_reviews.author: Badger48

customer_reviews.title: full coverage but slipping issues
customer_reviews.text: I'm torn with this product. I liked the versatility and robustness but... when my pitbull wears this, it shifts on her body. I try to tighten it but.. because of the design, where it tightens doesn't solve the shifting issue, it just stresses and chaffes the dog instead. Maybe it will work for you. But for mine, I need to find another solution.
customer_reviews.author: 0xyjen

customer_reviews.title: Sizing chart garbage. Way too small.
customer_reviews.text: Way too small. I measured my 12 week old puppy to get a harness to replace the other one she’s currently wearing. Sh is on her second harness. I buy one, it’s big and loose and within 2-3 weeks she has outgrown it. So she outgrew the first and now the second is getting tight. Those two were puppy harnesses for large breed puppies. So I ordered this harness and according to the size chart there should be room to grow. This harness is way too small. I can’t even get it on her. And it’s supposed to be bigger than my last one but it Is obviously much smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Paul

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for security, I would NOT recommend it
customer_reviews.text: We were initially very pleased with the harness, it seemed comfortable and didn't rub on our puppy's armpits as others had. Unfortunately, after a few weeks of use, it suddenly ripped and our puppy was loose (thankfully, after the walk and in our fenced-in yard). It was very unexpected and it didn't take much for our less-than-40lbs pup to get out of the harness once it had broken due to the location in which it ripped. See the image with the review to better understand the location of the rip. I'm extremely disappointed because I'm having a hard time getting ahold of the company to share this information with them. If you're looking for security, I would NOT recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie Suomala

customer_reviews.title: No-pull? Who are you kidding?
customer_reviews.text: My 70 pound puppy tows me around the block. The head collar is the only thing that keeps her from pulling. She doesn't like wearing it at all. I bought the No-Pull harness with skepticism. It makes me wonder what they were smoking when they named this product. Harness is properly adjusted and both attaching points were tried. She pulls harder than ever. Now I just need a snow sled so she can tow me with the "no-pull" harness.
customer_reviews.author: muff diver

customer_reviews.title: Caveat Emptor! Terrible on 70-lb Lab
customer_reviews.text: Big disappointment. I walk a 70 lb yellow lab who has major issues with pulling, lunging, and excitement when encountering other dogs. I hoped this would help. But it doesn't. A waste of money. It loosens constantly, and it rides up sideways in a very awkward way whenever I attempt to use it the way it is advertised - as a deterrent to forward lunging. I've tried using a single leash. I've tried it with a double leash. It's still a mess, and ineffective. I measured the dog carefully before ordering, so I know I got the right size. If anyone who has had a very different experience would like to offer me some tips, I'm open to that!
customer_reviews.author: Long Tall Sally

customer_reviews.title: not very strong.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this harness for a about 2 weeks i loved it. My dog seemed comfortable and i was able to control him..(hes a lab retriever/pitbull). Then we were running and the whole metal ring that you connect the leash to ripped off of the harness and my dog got away...waste of money for any dog bigger then 40 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No on No Pull
customer_reviews.text: The neck straps do not remain tight when the dog pulled. This is especially true when using the under the neck ring causing the harness to slip. I downgraded this since my original post because the company's response did not answer my question on how to keep the straps tight. There answer was to leave a 2 finger gap when tightening which does not answer the question.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Harness - fits well, easy to put on and take off
customer_reviews.text: My dog weighs a little over 50 pounds and I got the large one. After adjusting it to fit him - which only took about 5 minutes, this harness fits him very well. He has always pulled on walks, but not with this leash using the front clip. He sometimes does run ahead, but as soon as he feels the pull, he stops and waits for me. He has never done that before. I think he likes this a lot better than me constantly tugging on the leach. Our walks have been so much more enjoyable for both of us.
customer_reviews.author: mjmart61

customer_reviews.title: Makes my GSD look super cool.
customer_reviews.text: XL fits my 3 year old GSD perfectly. At first it looks small but after adjusting, suits our dog great. He seems to like it and does not bother him. The bottom strap has a spring effect that doesn't snag too much. Overall quality is very good. Looks like a very expensive collar with the reflective design. This item might cost 50-80 bucks if bought in a dog shop. I feel like we have a great deal for paying 17 bucks on this. We haven't tried if he will pull or not. We just like it so much. The back handle works good if to hold him if he's aggressive. Will update after we have a good walk with this.
customer_reviews.author: skydrol

customer_reviews.title: Not great for pulling
customer_reviews.text: Front clip harnesses are supposed to work by turning your dog around if they try to pull. This one just pulls off to the side and makes my dog limp along, it doesn't turn her around at all. She has also backed out of it on several occasions. I want a harness that will stay put and not allow escape for when we go hiking because she loves to sniff and does not like the gentle leader on her face when she's exploring new faces, but apparently if I don't want my arm to come off I will have to stick to the gentle leader.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe V.

customer_reviews.title: My lab responds much better now
customer_reviews.text: My super frisky 1 year old lab loves to run free and treats an ordinary collar/leash as a challenge. This harness she enjoys and respects. It almost makes me look like an effective trainer. Quite a difference from the git go. I hesitated with black color, but the subtle reflective surfaces are very effective in the dark. I ordered this when our lab was recovering from neck surgery, to avoid a regular collar on her suture area. But that’s just a plus; it’s well worthwhile regardless. It pairs very well with the rabbitgoo tactical bungee leash that has a well thought out bottom traffic handle. It’s a great combination. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Nile Solarian

customer_reviews.title: Front clip ripped right off.
customer_reviews.text: This harness was fine initially and seemed sturdy and well made for my 60 lb wheaten terrier. I use it to let him out on his tie out in our back yard for potty breaks and short walks. Today he was able to completely tear off the front clip and escape his leash. Luckily I caught up to him before he could get too far away. Maybe it's not intended to be used with a tie out but I can't see it holding up with the way he pulls during normal walks either. I've only been using it for 2 weeks. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BOTHER! NOT SAFE!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BOTHER TO BUY THIS LOW QUALITY HARNESS. The front adjusters are very easy to get loose. Today I put it on my dog, adjusted the front adjusters to be tight and went for a walk as usual. During the walk, my dog got spooked by something and pulled himself out of it! I LITERALLY WATCHED THE FRONT ADJUSTERS LOOSING UP BUT IT WAS TOO LATE TO STOP HIM. Luckily my dog knows the way home and ran back to the house. THIS IS ABSOLUTELY A WASTE OF MONEY! WILL BUY ANOTHER ONE AND FOREVER STAY AWAY FROM THIS BRAND!!
customer_reviews.author: forevermilo

customer_reviews.title: Gamechanger! I have a new dog!
customer_reviews.text: My 40lb terrier mix is all muscle. She can flat wear me out with the pulling. She almost pulled me flat on face going up some stairs a few weeks ago. That's when a friend recommended the rabbitgoo dog harness. The first walk was an eye opening experience for Ginger but she quickly adapted and now walks are a pleasure again. Have not tried stairs again yet so we shall see how that works out. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B

customer_reviews.title: although she truly has a sweet demeanor. With this harness
customer_reviews.text: I’m trying to change my review to five stars from three stars. They were not clear instructions with the packaging, which resulted in my using the harness incorrectly. My dog is an aggressive leash dog, pulling and barking at everybody, although she truly has a sweet demeanor. With this harness, her entire personality changed back to her sweet self. She was walking slowly, wagging her tail at people, and very friendly.Actually, she seemed to enjoy her walk more than usual! I’m looking forward to Pleasant neighborhood walks with this harness! I had to use the leash control on the chest in order to get this to happen. Also, I made it a very snug fit.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Ouimet

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my high maintenance Aussie who hates most everything that gets put on her. After a couple of adjustments, she wore it like she was in a beauty pageant. I then tried a leash on the two different clip points and there was no pulling or trying to get out of the harness. I also bought a larger size for my 8 month old rescue puppy and it was as if she had always worn a harness. She had constantly pulled at a leash when it was clipped to her collar, but this was effortless. I would buy these again and will most likely need to as the puppy gets larger.
customer_reviews.author: brm

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: We bought harnesses for two Collies who had completely different needs and the harness worked great for each of them. Our big male collie is an escape artist and likes to slip his collar if he gets excited or frightened. The harness is a comfortable, secure solution. No slipping out of this, he doesn't even try. Our elderly female collie needed extra help and support going up stairs or climbing into the car. The harness gave us a safe way to grab onto her with no discomfort and allowed us to give her guidance or a boost when needed. These harnesses are easy to adjust, well made and comfortable. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inconvenient and not effective
customer_reviews.text: The chest lead part doesn’t work for my dog- he still pulls and the harness just gets pulled to one side making it awkward for my dog to walk. Also don’t like that there’s no buckle for the part that goes around the neck. You have to slip it on over the head which is inconvenient for my dog because he’s a weird mutt with a big head but small neck/chest. I have to loosen this harness to get it over his head and then tighten it while it’s on him so it’s not super loose around his neck. Just too much work!
customer_reviews.author: TheBunBun

customer_reviews.title: BROKEN CLIP AND WRONG COLOR!
customer_reviews.text: VERY upset!!! First of all, the handle on this is terrible and NOT sturdy at all. Very flimsy and I could see it breaking very quickly. It also arrived with one of the clips broken! 😠 I recieved this in black, but I ordered the pink one. I have no idea how this happened or why I got the wrong color. It does seem very comfortable though and Im sure helps with pulling, but since the clasp is broken, I wouldn't know. Just wish I recieved the product I had actually ordered, not broken.
customer_reviews.author: HuskyMom

customer_reviews.title: Our Corso Loves it
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to comment on how nice something is when it actually does what it's advertised to do; however, after so many purchases on Amazon coming up way short, this deserves a 5 star rating. Our Corso is around 115 lbs and this leaves room for growth (not that we expect her to grow any larger). When you combine this with a quality pinch collar, you can expect your giant breed dog to be well behaved
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great Harness!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this leash. I believe my pup does too. He is a pulling little rascal! He can’t walk forward for looking backward. He excited about life but made our walks miserable. We got this harness and things are much better. This is what I like -Front and back leash attachment option -Easy on and off (have you ever tried to put a turtle neck on a puppy?) -reflective at night -easy adjusting -good price. -helps with training I’ll be back when our brat gets bigger and needs a new harness.
customer_reviews.author: Love shopping

customer_reviews.title: personally not for my dog
customer_reviews.text: I think the structure of this harness is great. I think it works great for dogs that need more security on their bodies for it to stay on but it was really uncomfortable for my dog. The chest plate was too stiff and uncomfortable for my Aussie. Enough for him to want to bite the straps and take it off. I luckily found a new brand that my aussie loves but this one is personally uncomfortable for mine.
customer_reviews.author: Capt.Dan

customer_reviews.title: Best looking harness! Quality is exceptional!
customer_reviews.text: This harness looks VERY good and even better in person. Wow. The quality is amazing. My Staffordshire Bull Terrier is all black with a white patch on his chest. This gray and black harness makes him look super mean and cool at the same time. The adjustments are plenty and is actually a bit stretchy to help slip on/off and I'm absolutely sure it's comfortable on him. You would think that this is a $50-90 harness. It has everything you need. He seems more responsive for some reason with this harness on. I truly believe it has some sort of mental/behavioral effect on him. Follow him on IG @iamcarbon
customer_reviews.author: yellowmelloboy

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought these
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these for my strong and energetic German Shepherds. They are both amazing dogs, but when they encounter another animal- forget it. It’s like game on. They jerk and pull relentlessly! It can be darn near impossible for me to contain them. So I skeptically bought these. I’m really glad that I did. It has been a big help to have these harnesses. I’m not gonna lie- the dogs still get totally triggered when they see an animal. They still try to tug free from my grip. With the harnesses though, their range of motion is much more limited. They still pull, but they can’t really go anywhere. So all in all, this harness has been quite helpful.
customer_reviews.author: LostAngel666

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy and stiff harness
customer_reviews.text: So, I’m returning this harness but I think the main reason why it didn’t work for my dog is because she’s a 8lbs puppy. It may be a good option for bigger dogs. I purchased the small size and had it shortened up to the limit. Her head would hardly pass through and the collar around her head felt very stiff and heavy. I didn’t like that about this harness. Very heavy. And stiff. Like the touch while using it may actually hurt her skin. Even so, she could still put her paw underneath and get completely crumbled in it. So overall very heavy, stiff Harness that would still not fit securely on my puppy
customer_reviews.author: Laura P

customer_reviews.title: No more pulling
customer_reviews.text: My 70 pound golden doodle was pulling my arm out of the socket, while he wore his old harness. On the last walk with him, prior to buying the rabbitgoo harness, I literally did not think I was going to make it back home without calling my husband to come to pick us up. I immediately went to Amazon and found good reviews on this harness. It is a total game changer! He seems totally happy to wear it and as long as I have the leash attached to the front of the harness, it works very well. He walks at my pace and we are both happy! He does not pull at all. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Jolain St John

customer_reviews.title: Good harness
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a good harness on the cheap for my Golden Retriever puppy. He’s 30 lbs but will prob be closer to 70 lbs in a year. I was planning on waiting to spend money on a harness until he is full grown. This harness has been great. I bought a size Large and put it as small as it will go. Almost a perfect fit right now with tons of room to grow. Looks great too. This is a good harness!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy T

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: This harness worked great for our Australian Shepherd. Our smaller dog got right out of hers once, we tightened it up but she still managed to sneak one of her front paws in front of the leg hole getting herself stuck and leaving my husband rather frustrated. It’s not a failing of the harness there are just some breeds that small harnesses are too small and mediums are too big. I think I have spent a small fortune in dog harnesses for her 😂 Leroy lives his and since he’s a stout boy it makes him easier to control if he gets up to no good. 😁
customer_reviews.author: ImaginaryFairy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Seller replaced first collar. The buckels broke and fell off in less than a week. Update: collar is falling apart with less than one months usage. ...The harness is well constructed and of good material. The only reason I give 4 stars is, it doesn’t fit well in the front. The front leash attachement is too low. My dog gets tangled in the leash as this design allows the front of harness to ride up and pull to the side. The harness doesn’t stay in place no matter how much you adjust or tighten.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Porter

customer_reviews.title: This harness has made our walks enjoyable. It's much easier to control our big puppy.
customer_reviews.text: This harness is well made and easy to put on our puppy. The front leash attachment works great if you have a problem with your pet pulling. Our puppy is a 5 month old Anatolian Shepherd that weighs about 75 pounds. He's still learning to follow commands and without this harness it was very difficult to control him when he got excited. Now it's very easy to control him and the leash is very well made and I really like the handle that is closer to the harness as it comes in handy during training to keep him beside me. I like the color choices. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ripped apart
customer_reviews.text: Three weeks into using and the harness completely ripped apart. My female pittie is incredibly strong and she loves to pull, but while using this harness she stopped pulling! I thought it was miraculous! Then while just playing with her in the backyard with her tied to her lead (so not going on a walk or anything, just playing) the whole thing completely ripped apart at the seams. Very disappointed. Complete waste of money. Hopefully I can still return. Update: We got a replacement harness and this one only lasted two days before it ripped. Don’t waste your money if you have a muscular dog.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie D.

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable price for value
customer_reviews.text: Incredible value for the quality of the harness. Sturdy stitching, built-in expansion elastic to provide a little stretch around the chest for breathing, and quality metal rings. My 2 boxer mix dogs instantly pull 90% less now when walking, and it has improved our relationship because instead of fighting me the whole way and getting upset, they are now attentive and calm. Watch out for rubbing under the armpits though. One of my dogs gets raw spots in the armpits after a few walks, so I only use the halter occasionally when she needs a reminder of how to behave on walks. The Large fits my 55 lb boxer mixes, with plenty of room to adjust either larger or smaller.
customer_reviews.author: hoopsandhorses

customer_reviews.title: Get control back when walking your Dog, no matter what size!
customer_reviews.text: Lightning fast delivery, well made construction, superb price. Exactly what I needed to take control of a 60# and 95# dogs with strong type A personalities. They bolt to chase a cat/squirrel/whatever and the ring clip mounted on the chest that your leash clips to, spins them around so that they're suddenly facing you going, "OMG, what just happened?!" No more hurts to the ol rotater cuffs, ouch! No more jerking me off my feet! I'm in control now when going for walks, as God originally intended, trust me! Whomever invented this special harness, a million times THANK YOU!!! I ordered the XL for my 95 lb Shepard/Husky mix and it fits perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: With this harness and leash, less pulling, more enjoyable walks wit your dog
customer_reviews.text: It’s very easy to put on my dog. She has learnt when I bring out her harness equals to a walking. I like that I can control my dog’s pulling (when she sees another dog) with the shorter part of the leash. I dreaded walking my dog prior to buying this product because my wrist would get so sore after her walks because of her pulling whenever she saw a dog(s) or people (wants to play). This harness and leash has made walking my dog so much easier because she doesn’t pull as much and I’m able to control her better. Price didn’t hurt either. I would definitely buy this product again and refer it to other people with dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Layla

customer_reviews.title: Even better than expected- dog actually stopped pulling
customer_reviews.text: This harness had great reviews, but I did not expect to see such positive change in my dog's behavior so rapidly. Instead of pulling hard when walking, she now leaves some slack in her leash and responds more quickly to any changes in direction or corrections. She is a fairly set in her ways German Shepherd, so I figured we'd have a battle of wills at first, but she completely accepted the harness changeout with no issue. This harness has really made our walks much more enjoyable, and I feel like I have increased control and therefore safety on our walks. I would definitely recommend this harness.
customer_reviews.author: Grace618

customer_reviews.title: Size small
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice harness but I wish it came in extra small. Buddy weighs 13 pounds. I had to tighten the neck as far as it would go and you can see in the pictures how much of the strap is hanging down on middle adjustment. That said he acted like it was comfortable. The front ring is low and when I hook the lease there he gets his leg tangled init. That may be because he is small. The description said you could use for chihuahuas. I have owned chihuahuas and it would be too big. I bought size small
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Very good harness-make sure it fits!
customer_reviews.text: Just be CAREFUL! My very nervous dog measured for a medium, and even though I had it adjusted to the tightest fit, she got scared outside and slipped RIGHT out of it. I’ve ordered a small so we’ll see how that goes but my advice to anyone, especially if you have a young, newly adopted or fearful dog, is to use a backup collar and leash until you’re certain this harness properly fits. Other than that, it looks and feels sturdy and well-made. UPDATE: Got the SMALL and it’s perfect! I would normally never get my dog a size small in anything (25 pound Rat Terrier Mix), so that tells me that this harness just might run big.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Better than a collar (Size Medium / ~40lb dog)
customer_reviews.text: This is a great harness! About a week after getting this harness, we stopped putting a collar on our dog for walks. 5 months later and we couldn't be happier. The quality is excellent, it's easy to put on and take off, and our dog walks better and pulls less than with a collar. She's also more secure because a couple of times she pulled out of the collar either because it wasn't securely latched or it was too loose but that has never happened with this harness. It snaps closed loudly and securely. I've seen other dogs with flimsy harnesses that don't look anywhere near as secure or comfortable as this one from Rabbitgoo. We definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Dad

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for us
customer_reviews.text: This didn’t really work for our new rescue dog that hadn’t been previously leashed trained. It reduced his tugs, but tended to rotate to one side or the other. We ended up using a regular collar and a bag of training treats to get him more comfortable with walking on the leash.
customer_reviews.author: RVwino

customer_reviews.title: quit looking!
customer_reviews.text: I was uncertain about getting Loki a new harness, cuz he's a plump smooth fox terrier [29lbs of solid muscle lol], and find one that fit in stores wasn't possible, but this one is perfect. it's sturdy, accurate to the sizing chart and a great value for the price. I paired it with the Mowis Retractable leash and they match perfectly. I have no doubt that it will last a long time, and that's saying something when it some to terriers.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Steffie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: First, the harness arrived the day after I ordered it!😊 I just sized it to my 45 lb. Beaskie (half beagle/half Siberian husky). She already had a very nice front and top attach harness, but it was a bit snug around her chest and way to big front to back. After measuring Trixie, I decided to order a Large with some concern that it would be too large. It took several tries, but I finally got it almost right and walked her as a reward for her patience! I’ll tinker just a bit more and am confidant that this will fit and last a long time. It is handsome and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Curious in TN

customer_reviews.title: *Some-pull harness
customer_reviews.text: I bought this harness in a medium and large for my two german shorthaired pointers. While it has significantly improved the quality of our walks, it still is not perfect. There is still some pull with a 50lb puppy who wants to go every direction. I still can't walk them at the same time because they yank in different directions. I can see that they are frustrated by the leash going across their front leg. Also, if your dog keeps their nose low to the ground like mine, they will often have the leash go between their legs and get stuck there. Overall a good harness, but not perfect
customer_reviews.author: Sydney McGagin

product_meta.title: rabbitgoo Dog Harness, No-Pull Pet Harness with 2 Leash Clips, Adjustable Soft Padded Dog Vest, Reflective No-Choke Pet Oxford Vest with Easy Control Handle for Large Dogs, Black, (L, Chest 20.5-36")
feature_bullets: 【 LARGE DOG HARNESS 】 - ★ Measuring Neck Girth: 16.1" - 23.2", Chest Girth: 20.5" - 36" ★. Let us know anytime you need help in finding the right size for your lovely dog. Recommended Breeds: Medium to Large Dogs, such as Golden Retriever, Huskie, Labrador, Alaska, German Shepherd, Akita, etc. Make your puppy stand out with this Classic Black Harness!

【 NO PULL, NO CHOKE 】- Our non-pulling dog harness is specially designed with 2 Metal Leash Rings for safer dog walks. Use the CHEST attachment clip to stop your dog from pulling on walks, perfect for dog training or dogs who tend to pull. The BACK one is great for casual walks, jogging, hiking, etc

【 EASY TO USE 】- This hassle-free overhead harness is easy to put on and take off with its 2 Fast-release Buckles. SLIDE the harness over your dog's head, BUCKLE it up, ADJUST the straps, and here you go! Grab the Top Handle for additional control. Lightweight and easy to clean

【 FULLY ADJUSTABLE 】- This adjustable harness features 4 easy Adjusting Straps around the body. You can use its 2 neck straps and 2 chest straps to create a Perfect Fit for your dog with some room of growth. No worries about slipping out or choking

【 SAFE AND COMFORTABLE 】- Your dog will enjoy the daily walk in this comfort dog harness! Made of durable Nylon Oxford and padded with Soft Cushion to protect your dog's skin. Breathable air mesh keeps your dog cool during outdoor activities. Super bright Reflective Strips ensure a SAFE walk both day and night

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars38,829 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
